content.question: In the second paragraph, the two commas in the last sentence serve which of the following purposes?

choices.label: They create an equivalency between the author’s assertions in the last two clauses and a claim of his opponents in the first clause.
They separate three related objections to which the author imagines himself responding.
They set off a clause that clarifies an idea introduced in the first clause.
They connect the author’s ideas to those of his imagined audience.

content.answer: They separate three related objections to which the author imagines himself responding.

skill.text: Skill 7.C: Explain how grammar and mechanics contribute to the clarity and effectiveness of an argument.
